channel.title: JLS contributions
channel.description:
**Objects:**
**- Seq**
* **wolfram_seq.axo** - Wolfram cellular automata sequencer * **peuclid_seq.axo** - Pseudo euclidean sequencer
**- Lfo**
* **chaotic_lfo.axo** - Simple chaotic lfo
**- Osc**
* **chaotic_osc.axo** - Not well tuned chaotic oscillator * **chua_osc.axo** - Chua chaotic oscillator * **lorenz_osc.axo** - Lorenz chaotic attractor - oscillator * **rossler_osc.axo** - Rossler chaotic attractor - oscillator
**Patches:**
* **ping_noodle.axp**

item.title: JLS contributions
item.dc:creator: @mastaman magnus
item.description:
@mastaman wrote:

Wolfram_seq is so nice i just wish i could change the rule, width and maybe even the mode without restarting the patcher...i tried to "hack" it. But it looks like the rules are set in the INIT code (i am not a coder)...so maybe a complete rewrite is needed to be able to change those parameters live. They are pretty cheep to run so i guess i could use a switch and a set of wolfram seq's with different rules preset and switch between them...but it feels a bit of a cpu waste Good stuff. Thanks!

Read full topic
